title: What if Austria started WW2? Like say if Germany and Austria switched places with Austria having to pay reparations in the treaty of versailles and basically going down germanys path in our time. - Quora

response.answer_text: Our Army was pretty small (still is), if we'd try to pay reparations it would have been even smaller. So let's see, whom could we have attacked? Liechtenstein? Ok, we might have won this one. Germany, Italy, Hungary, Tchechoslovakia? Unlikely that we could have won that. Slowenia? Eventualy. Our potential to start a successfull war was pretty limited. We would have been stopped pretty soon. That would have not been enough for a world war.

I do not quite understand this question. If we are talking about an interest Germany that remains politically inert while contemporary Austria becomes an aggressor, then quite simply the post-war Austrian republic would not be nearly large enough to threaten its neighbours. Never mind Italy, Czechoslovakia should be able to handle itself. Even Hungary and Yugoslavia could wage successful defensive wars.
